Description: Interpret, think, enact! Biology nerds, this is your time to take over. Pair up with a friend and come together to enjoy a bunch of cool activities. Spend four full hours needing out! See you on 2nd April :)
Rules and Regulations:
The event wil have 2 rounds.
Round 1: 10 Diseases will be shown through projector in pictorial form. Each team will consist of two people. All questions are compulsory.
Round 2: Teams who qualify the first round will get to enact the diseases they are told (in a dumb charades format).
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 50 per team

Description: It can't get any higher resolution than this. Join us in The Critter Hunt, where you look out to search for the most unique specimen to examine under a microscope.
Rules and Regulations: Find and mount interesting micro/macroscopic invertebrates and get points based on your ability to grab creepy crawlies
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 30 per team

Description: An event aimed towards school students from underprivileged backgrounds, that encourages them to create science models and present them as exhibition.
Rules and Regulations:
The purpose of this event is to sow the seeds of curiosity and enthusiasm for science in young minds. We are planning for a science workshop where the school students can comprehend the real essence of science rather than just the conventional textbook knowledge.

The workshop will focus on incorporating creativity with their scientific mind thus enhancing their ability to construct new ideas.
The main event will be segregated into two age groups
  • 5th grade to 8th grade
  • 9th grade to 12th grade

The event also comprises a science exhibition focusing on making them inquisitive , true to the name of the fest.
Registration Deadline: Open to all with no registration deadline

Description:
Ever felt like breaking from the binding pull of gravity? This is your chance... All you need is creativity and a bit of H20.

Thrust is Inquivesta's very own rocket assembly line, where participants get to make their own water-powered rockets, and compete against each other to craft the ultimate flying machine.
Rules and Regulations:
For Newbies:
Attend a fun workshop on Building Water Rockets with us on Saturday (2pm) and we will teach you how to build your very own flying spectacle.
Finished rockets will be launched in the evening, competing against eachother to see who goes the farthest.

For the Experienced:
Get your own Water Rocket to showcase in the competition. Rockets will be judged on how much range they can cover. There will be a special prize for the most elegant design. You can either bring your own launcher or use the one we provide to you.
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 100 per team

Description:
Have you ever thought what would happen if you drop an egg from the first floor of your house? Well duh, it would obviuosly break.
But wait a minute, what if you needed to save it... So, get ready to lock horns with gravity as you try to protect your precious eggs against the much-feared drop in Beat the Drop
Rules and Regulations:
• Participants need to form a team of 2 or 3 and attempt to create a device that can keep a raw chicken egg intact when dropped from a height.
  • Participants are asked to build a device made from a limited number of materials provided to them in 45 minutes to support an egg when dropped from various heights.
  • The participants will not be allowed to use their mobile phones.
Registration Deadline:
Online Registration deadline is 31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST.However, spot registrations will be open.
Registration fee: Rs. 150 per team
Contact Details:
Sougata Mondal sm22ms013@iiserkol.ac.in 9002161586
Niravra Nag nn22ms072@iiserkol.ac.in 8697345673

Description:
Get ready to put your creativity to test as you are challenged to do even the simplest of the tasks with ingenious mechanisms constructed out of scrap.
So get ready to do some "jugaad" and take part in The NutJob.
Rules and Regulations:
• A team can have upto three members
  • Each team will be given a set of household items like disposable cups, straws, threads etc.
  • A task will given at the start of the competition to all the teams.
  • The teams have to design and build a machine out of the given materials that performs the task.
  • You can have up to 2 hints, each of which will come with a time penalty .
  • The coolest and the most unique contraption wins.
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 100 per team

Description: One of Inquivesta's trademark scientific debate competiition. Science and Technology are all about the truth, as well as the rightfull application of the truth for some benefit. However in today's complicated world, various concepts and opinions exist about ethics itsels. Join the ultimate Debate and establish your truth! Of course, rationale-y!
Rules and Regulations:
• The event will be organised in 3 stages:
    • The Preliminary rounds
    • The Semi-finals
    • The Finals.
    Points of the previous rounds will NOT be added for the evaluation in the further rounds.
  • Format of the Preliminary Round MODIFIED OXFORD FORMAT
  • The Semi-Finals will be conducted in the MODIFIED CAMBRIDGE FORMAT
  • The final round will be conducted in the BRITISH PARLIAMENTARY FORMAT
  • For further details, refer to the manual here
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 200 per team
Contact Details:
Subham Biswas sb22ms152@iiserkol.ac.in +917029497277
Pritam Sadhu ps22ms140@iiserkol.ac.in +919793681104

Description: Unleash your inner scientist and showcase your genius at Fauxpert - where creativity meets knowledge!
Rules and Regulations:
There will be both an online round and an offline round.
  • The online round will require teams to submit a 10 page report before 30th of March, the details of which can be found on the registrations page.
  • All registered teams can also participate in the offline round, which will be conducted on campus on the 2nd of April, 2023.
  • The team will have to present on stage a 5 minute report on the topic given to them 2 days before the event.
Prizes: Online Round : Rs 500   Offline Round : 1st prize-Rs 1000 2nd prize-Rs 500
Registration Deadline:
29th April
Registration fee: Rs. 50 per team

Description: Mathquivesta - Build from Scratch is a novel pan-India maths contest where you build a mathematical framework for a problem from scratch. The process is divided into several simple steps - and it relies more on your problem solving ability and creativity rather than knowledge. While the problems are simple, they try to invoke the spirit of research in you as you inch closer and closer to your goal.
Rules and Regulations: Teams of upto 4 are allowed to participate in the event. The paper for the contest will be provided to the correspondence emails at 6:00 pm, Friday, March 31st and submission form will close at 11:59 pm, Sunday, April 2nd sharp.
Prizes:
First Prize: Rs.4098
Creative Prize: Rs.1024
Registration Deadline: 31st March

Description: Rock Paper Scissors - Evolution through Games brings forward the popular genre of sansukumi-ken games in their original flavour. Get a chance to witnessq how Rock Paper Scissors (RPS) like games are used in Evolutionary Biology - where coexistence of cyclically dominant species can be seen as a result of RPS (rock-paper-scissor) games in non-ergodic Volterra models.
Rules and Regulations: A group of 4-5 people play the game (for a set number of rounds) and the overall winner (after tie-breaks) gets a prize! Note that for the sake of fairness, nobody can play more than 3 games.
Prizes: Rs. 20 per game, consisting of several rounds
Registration Deadline: 31st March

Description: No matter what, Inquivesta would be incomplete without one of its legacy events, Crime Scene Investigation. Get ready to put on your thinking caps and crack codes, work with clues, investigate the crime scene, interrogate people and deduce who the real culprit is within the span of two days.
Rules and Regulations:
The event will last 2 days
  • Day 1: All teams will get to investigate a crime scene from which they need come to a conclusion.
  • Day 2: Top 15 teams from day 1 will be selected to investigate the story further on Day 2.
  • Teams will be judged on the basis of the clues identified by them and the time taken
  • Inter college teams are allowed to participate
Registration Deadline:
First 60 teams
Registration fee: Rs. 200 per team
Contact Details:
Mandar Tijare (tmr21ms016@iiserkol.ac.in) (9920827228)
Deepak Kudari (dak21ms202@iiserkol.ac.in) (9148001921)
Shreeyash Chaudhari (sc21ms182@iiserkol.ac.in)(9137971093)

Description:
It is a known fact that humans like to be tested and to compete against each other to assert dominance over the opposition. It has historically been proven that it is the Brain and Brawn who comes out on top.
Quizzing provides a brilliant activity to keep the same spirit of competition with your opponents using your brainpower by forcing one to think outside the box to work on trivia-based questions, with the hints or relations that are to be searched for in the questions. With this same objective in mind, we bring you GNQ, The Quizzing event of INQUIVESTA X!
Rules and Regulations:
• The theme of the quiz shall be General Theme
  • As INQUIVESTA X is a Science Festival, you may encounter a tinge of Science
  • The quiz shall be conducted in two rounds, the first round being the elimination round
  • The top 8 teams from this round shall proceed to the final round to battle for the grand prize
Prizes: Prizes worth Rs.4,000 to be won
Registration fee: Rs.150 per team for online and Rs.200 per team for spot registrations
Registration Deadline:
Online registrations deadline is 31 March 2023 with a registration fee of Rs. 150 per team
Spot registrations will be open though with a registration fee of Rs. 200 per team

Description: From Ascent to Haven, Fracture to Pearl, We present to you the mega valorant tournament for all those gamers. A tournament with exciting prizes and lots of enjoyment with your felllow teammates and opponents.
Rules and Regulations:
• This will be a 5v5 tournament
  • Each team must present one representativewho shall be responsible for choosing maps for their team
  • The prelims will consist of a single match while the Grand Finale will be best of three.
  • Players are requested to bring their own laptops and peripherals, if not then will be provided.
Location: Seminfinals and Final will be done in LHC G02
Registration Deadline:
Online Registration deadline is 27th march. Registration closed at it.
Registration fee: Rs. 100 per team
Contact Details:
Raj Vikrant Brahma 7896874152
Youktik Sajjan 9330192230
gcik@iiserkol.ac.in

Description: A gathering of the admirer of the Japanese Otaku culture, literature and animations , consisting of exciting events like cosplay, aniquiz, Karaoke (Possibly) , weeb dance and many more........
Rules and Regulations:
Enjoy the mega cosplay event of Anicon 2.0, Cosplay Riot where you will see your favourite anime characters in flesh and blood (Without any super power though).
Win the ultimate cosplay title, Subarashii Cosplayer and audience choice prize Audiences' Allowance . Relive nostalgia by delivering a heartfelt dialogue and win the Delightful Dialogue award or recreate lively scenes from your favourite anime and win the Petrifying Performance award. For a more laid-back experience, join us for Karaoke (possibly)and sing Yabure Kabure. You can express your excitement and eloquence in the random interviews.(Bad news for introverts though). Finally, we'll say goodbye with a weeb dance-off.

Bring your fellow weebs to Anicon and enjoy the exciting experience together....
Registration fee: Rs. 169 audience with free poster and games
Registration Deadline:
Online registrations.
Deadline: April 1, 2023, midnight
Registration fee: Rs. 169 includes free poster and games

Description: It is what it is
Rules and Regulations: Standard rapid event with time format 10+0
Prizes: First Prize: Rs. 3000/- Second Prize: Rs. 2000/- Third Prize: Rs. 1000/-
Registration Deadline:
31st March 2023 12:00 AM IST
Registration fee: Rs. 100 per per head
On spot registration may be opened on the day of the event depending on the situation

Description: An exciting dance competition where individuals/duos/groups have to showcase pre-rehearsed performances to get exciting prizes!
Rules and Regulations: The dance performance should have a time limit of 2 minutes, not more than that. There are no restricitons on the dance style. Register for the event through google form.
Prizes: 1st prize - Rs 3000 and many other exciting prizes and merch for other winners
Registration Deadline: TBD

Description: Just a fun event starting at mid night for relaxation, jokes and gossips.
Rules and Regulations: Event starts at midnight, Have fun, start performing in front of an open mic. Just don't be Political, immoral or immaturely vulgar. Don't target anyone and disturb the integrity of the event.
Location: LHC tree space or near water tank(rain)
Registration Deadline: No registration required

Description: For the growing number of K-Pop fans in India; Play the games that your favorite celebrities (idols) play!
Rules and Regulations:
Daebak Trivia Quiz:
Compete with other fans in the given 30 seconds and answer as many questions as you can. The quiz will consist of three rounds:
Round 1 is a qualifier round, from where 10 of the players will advance to Round 2 and finally 5 of those will advance to Round 3. 2 out of 5 will win!

Shout in silence:
Two players should work as a team, they will desperately try to communicate while listening to loud K-Pop through headphones. Those who manage to communicate atleast 5 of the given messages in 2 minutes will win!

K-Bop or K-Flop:
The game involves the player suggesting a K-pop song to non-K-Pop fans who will act as judges and rate the song that was suggested to them. Those suggesting songs that garner highest ratings from the judges are entitled to amazing prizes!
Registration Deadline:
Till the day of the event
Registration fee: Rs. 30 per participant

Description: Musical event where a single performer can perform with a karaoke or backing instrument.
Rules and Regulations:
• Participants have to register on the spot itself in order to participate.
  • Participants are requested to keep their backing tracks ready and should be able to email or whatsapp to a given contact as soon as possible.
  • The time limit for each performance is 3 minutes
  • All genres of music are allowed.
  • Participants would be performing in a first come first perform manner
  • There will be 2 judges of the event whose combined marks would be considered for the final result
  • Any participant disturbing the integrity of the show would be disqualified.
  • Only solo performances are allowed.
  • Participants can use backing instruments too.
Registration: To be done on the spot.
Registration Deadline:
On Spot Registration only
Registration fee: Rs. 50 per participant

Description: Vibe with some of the largest social media creators and business personality. Never before have you got such an oppurtunity to form connections with some of the coolest people. From comedians to entreupreneurs, we have got it all covered.
Rules and Regulations: You just need to be present
Registration Deadline: NA
